definition: to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to distance oneself from (classical)
boat/ship/craft/to navigate/to sail/to fly
to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission

sentences.english: The sea in the sails, call your motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召喚你揚帆遠航，高山在激勵你奮力攀登。

sentences.english: We can sail, we can sail with the orinoco flow.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們，去遠航，順着奧裏諾科流。

sentences.english: My liege, I ask you to fund a voyage into the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的大人，我請求你資助一次探索未知的遠航。

sentences.english: Captain Cook(CC) is preparing for his first great expedition to thePacific.
sentences.chinese: 庫克船長正在爲到太平洋的第一次遠航探險而做準備。

sentences.english: It is the only seagoing minesweeper operated by the PLA Navy.
sentences.chinese: 它是被PLA海軍操作的唯一適於遠航的掃雷艦。

sentences.english: Even as We sail and sail, We are a still picture.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我們啓航，揚帆遠航，我們是一個靜止圖像。

sentences.english: No matter how many hardness and misery, we also can , set sail far away.
sentences.chinese: 就算有太多，艱辛苦難，我們也能，遠航揚帆。

sentences.english: There are two groups of tugboats, either Inland or Oceangoing .
sentences.chinese: 有兩個團體的拖船，無論是內陸或遠航。

sentences.english: The bows turn, the freighted ship tacking speeds away under her gray sails.
sentences.chinese: 舵輪轉，重船搶風加速灰帆揚旗快去遠航。

sentences.english: Does the grass folk contrast for what adult build being the ship that the distant aptitude sail can fight, how canning?
sentences.chinese: 草民爲大人造的是能遠航能打仗的船，怎麼能比呢？

sentences.english: Have tough-minded boy only, ability appeases billows, hoist the sails Yuan Hang.
sentences.chinese: 只有意志堅強的小夥子，才能平息波瀾，揚帆遠航。

sentences.english: So 1492 ,of course, Columbus sails the ocean blue to America.
CC：I insist on taking proper food for thisexpedition.
sentences.chinese: 我堅持這次遠航探險要攜帶上合適的食品。

sentences.english: We are fitting out the ship for a long voyage.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在裝備這艘船，以便能作遠航。

sentences.english: But having any sort of ocean-going capability is good for national pride.
sentences.chinese: 只要擁有任何程度上遠航能力都可以提升民族自豪感。

sentences.english: Let me sail, let me sail, let the orinoco flow.
sentences.chinese: 多麼想，去遠航，讓奧裏諾科流淌。

definition: to set sail
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 起航[qi3 hang2]
to wail/to cry out in distress
sail/sailing boat
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to be stranded (of ship)/to run aground/fig. to run into difficulties and stop
wind and waves/stormy sea
to cross (a body of water)
to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]
(of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
daybreak/dawn
perilous situation
press conference
Zheng He (1371-1433), famous early Ming dynasty admiral and explorer
lit. covered in dust (idiom)/fig. travel-worn
to salvage/to dredge/to fish out (person or object from the sea)
